events.name: Familie Redlich
events.description: During my studies at the Berlin University of Applied Sciences (BHT), I participated in an internship. In the agency Familie Redlich I learned to create websites and was able to work on my own website until the end. This website contained a memory game for children. The whole thing took place in the context of the S-Bahn Kids campaign.

events.name: Akademie der Wissenschaften
events.description: At the Academy of Sciences I was able to further deepen my knowledge in website design and development. I even participated in a project, which was nominated for and won the DARIAH DE DH Award 2018.

events.name: Revvis Ltd.
events.description: I was working as a software developer in a small team of 3 people. We were developing a web application for a company that provides a service for managing and monitoring the energy consumption of buildings. The application was written in PHP and JavaScript. I was responsible for the development of the backend part of the

events.name: iXtenda GmbH
events.description: I was working as a technical artist in a small team of 6 people. We were developing multiple applications in C#. My main role was creating an UI design.

events.name: Lessing Gymnasium
events.description: I graduated from the Lessing Gymnasium in Berlin. I got my best grades in computer class and art.

events.name: Berliner Hochschule f√ºr Technik (BHT)
events.description: I started my media informatics studies at the Berlin University of Applied Sciences (BHT). There I learned the basics of Java, Git, app development (Android and iOS), software development, databases, UI/UX design and Unity.

events.name: University of Applied Sciences in Berlin, Germany
events.description: I was studying computer science at the University of Applied Sciences in Berlin. I was learning about the basics of computer science, algorithms, data structures, databases, operating systems, networks, software engineering, and many more.
